ygData.subject: Re: [gladiator] Wish List Part 1 and Why bother?
ygData.msgSnippet: if we somehow get our hands on the scenario file format, I de be interested in working on an editor.  My programming might be kinda rusty though. It would

if we somehow get our hands on the scenario file format, I'de be
interested in working on an editor.  My programming might be kinda rusty
though. It would probably be good if we could use java, because it's
fairly simple and has free compiler and developement kit. either that or
the GNU C compiler, again because it's free,  though more complicated
than java I think.  I have a feeling the format is not overly complex
and someone that knew what they were doing could probably figgure it
out,  but that would take quite a bit of work.  it would be interesing
to try and figgure out but I do have a summer vacation to enjoy and
several other prodjects (mostly linux stuff) that I'm working on ;)

Daniel Paul Hightower wrote:
> 
> 1)Why are we bothering with this discussion?  In the off-chance that
> somebody at FSGames make give us access to scenario specs.
> 
> I agree it needs to be start from stratch for the most part with a
> new editor.  It should combine features from both scen.exe and
> editor.exe .  Resizing should definitely be in the features of the
> new scenario editor.  I had to resize 'The Weakest Link' in much the
> same way Telvido has had to do with his scenarios.
> 
> Wait a minute:  There is a feature in editor.exe to allow you to
> replace all of one tile type to another?
> 
> I think that brings up another point:  The documentation for the new
> scenario editor needs to be very complete, listing all features and
> explaining how to access them.  Copy-and-paste feature for objects
> should be included as well as undelete.  A nice touch would be
> allowing us to control the individual stats for NPCs and opponents
> (Example: setting the intelligence level of a mage at an extremely
> high level).
> 
> The Gladiator Mailing List
> 
> 
> Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
